alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:06PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Camden, and northwestern Currituck Counties, the southeastern City of Norfolk, the eastern City of Chesapeake and the City of Virginia Beach through 445 PM EDT... At 406 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Norfolk International to near Great Bridge to near South Mills. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Wesleyan University, Kempsville, Regent University, Norfolk and Norfolk International around 410 PM EDT. Fentress around 415 PM EDT. Virginia Beach and Back Bay around 430 PM EDT. Princess Anne and Northwest around 435 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Rudee Heights, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Oceana NAS, Sharon, Munden, Macons Corner and Pungo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
